result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Dakota J. Juno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Conditions of Counts 2, 3, and 4:  

No contact with the victim.  

Submit to sex offender evaluation and treatment.

Follow all rules and regulations of probation.

Pay costs.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department and pay the DNA surcharge to Department of Corrections (pay while on probation).

Condition of Count 2 only:  6 months conditional jail time, with work release/huber but no good time; may be served in any Wisconsin county jail that will accept.

(Defendant has a four-year diversion agreement with the DA on Count 1 in this case.  That is not a probation count.)

timeConds.notes: With work release/huber and no good time.  Stayed until on or before June 15, 2015 between 6-7 a.m.  May be served in any Wisconsin county jail that will accept.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
With huber/work release.  Counts 2, 3, and 4 concurrent with each other with these specific directions from Judge Sharp for the Sheriff's Department regarding credit:

Count 2 is to receive 9 months or 272 days credit.
Counts 3 and 4 are to receive 90 days credit.

Court has directed the Clerk to enter 90 days credit has the total number calculation that appears on the bottom of the JOC, noting that the Defendant actually has an additional 6 months credit due to the 9 months credit for concurrent count 2.

Defendant's costs from the original JOC, not paid while on probation, are ordered entered now as a civil judgment with the Defendant as the debtor and the Clerk of Court as the creditor.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Dakota J. Juno
Current: 800 1/2 Roosevelt St, Fennimore, WI 53809 United States  (Effective: 08-11-2017)
Prior: 123 East Racine Street, Janesville, WI 53545 United States
Petition and Order Revoking Huber Privileges

Defendant Dakota J. Juno in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing after revocation in 14CF79 and initial appearance in 16CF87.  

16CF87 - formal reading waived; charge stated and def informed of his rights including right to prelim.  Atty. M states def waives his right to prelim; State is filing information.  Def waives rights to prelim; colloquy conducted and waiver accepted.  Bindover ordered.  

DA Harper details the agreement of the parties in these matters, calling for 9 mo jail, concurrent with one another on the revoked probation counts in 14CF79.  On the felony bail jumping charge in 16CF87, DA states that the parties request 12 mo jail, consec. to the 9 months.  DA states the State is NOT revoking the DPA on Count 1 in 14CF79.  Atty. M notes that def did 6 mo conditional time on one of the misdemeanor; asking for (3) 9-month sentences to run together.  Atty. M states the State is asking for expungement on the felony bail jumping in 16CF87 upon completion of the 12-month sentence.

16CF87 - def pleads guilty to felony bail jumping.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.

14CF79 - counts 2, 3, and 4 - sentence:  9 months jail, with huber, concurrent with each other.  Count 2- 9 months credit/272 days.  Counts 3 and 4 - 90 days credit.  Court directs clerk to enter 90 days credit as the total number tabulation on JOC but to provide verbage on the JOC that the def actually has an additional 6 months credit due to the 9 months credit for concurrent count 2.  Work release.  Pay costs as civil judgment.

16CF97 - 12 months jail, no credit, consecutive to 14CF79.  Expungement after 12 months jail is complete and full payment has been made of the court costs due to the clerk.  Civil judgment to be entered if costs not paid within 60 days.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Agent S has indicated that rev order/warrant hard copy is coming; Atty. McDougal asks for sentencing after rev scheduling
RCSD dispo report - "time served"
Motion and order to extend furlough
Court's reply to def. re. request.
from Def to the Court - request for shortened sentenced
Diversion Agreement
AMENDED INFORMATION

Defendant Dakota J. Juno in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Matter set on the calendar as status but parties have indicated that they wish to proceed to disposition.  State files amended information.  DA states terms of the jt recommendation:  def to plead no contest to 1 felony and 3 misdemeanors per the counts on the amended information.  DA has stated the recommendation for 2 years probation on counts 2-4 with no expungement possibility - def to have no contact with victim, submit to s.o. evaluation and treatment, pay costs, and serve 6 months conditional jail time for count 2.  Jt recommendation also calls for a four-year diversion agreement on count 1.  Def pleads no contest to all four counts.  Court's colloquy on pleas, prelim having been waived with colloquy.  Counsel and def address the Court.  

Court follows jt recommendation for 4-year diversion agreement on Count 1.  Counts 2-4:  2 years probation on withheld sentence.  Conditions:  6 months jail conditional time on count 2; all counts, no contact with victim, submit to s.o. evaluation and treatment, pay costs, submit DNA sample.  

Atty. Angel asks for stay of conditional time to June 15th.  DA has no objection as long as def signs up for probation today.

Court allows stay of conditional time to June 15th between 6-7 a.m.  

0 days credit.  Def may serve the sentence in any Wisconsin county jail that accepts.
Status conference at 05-15-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Dakota J. Juno in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Information filed.  Formal reading waived.  To the charge, def stands mute for entry of NG plea.  DA states victims are asking for speedy disposition.  Status requested and set for May 15 at 1:30.  Court states that, if there's no resolution by May 15th, Court will set trial date to keep the matter moving swiftly.  Status conference scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Arraignment at 04-15-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Dakota J. Juno in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defense submits waiver of preliminary hearing. Colloquy re waiver of prelim. Court will accept waiver of prelim, binds def over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
